definition: long-cherished wish
constellation
lodge for the night/old/former
night/classifier for nights
surname Su
to hope/to wish/to desire/hoped-for/ready/willing

sentences.english: Her life long desire of living in the country was at last realised.
sentences.chinese: 她嚮往過鄉下生活的宿願最後實現了。

sentences.english: To effect objects so dear to every patriot I shall devote myself with anxious solicitude.
sentences.chinese: 爲達成每個愛國者的宿願，我將迫不及待地全力以赴。

sentences.english: Her life-long desire of living in the country was at last realized.
sentences.chinese: 她嚮往過鄉下生活的宿願最後實現了。

sentences.english: To visit Mount Tai has been Chinese wish for thousands years.
sentences.chinese: 登遊泰山是數千年來炎黃子孫的宿願。

sentences.english: And for realization of a win-win result.
sentences.chinese: 從而，最中實現我共創雙贏的美好宿願。

sentences.english: In the meantime please be assured of our most cordial good wishes and of our desire to be of service.
sentences.chinese: 同時，請牢記我們最傳奇的宿願和爲您服務的熱望。

sentences.english: The plan rode rough-shed over Churchill's cherished ideas.
sentences.chinese: 這項計劃粗暴地粉碎了邱吉爾的宿願。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
paper dolls for ritual use in the shape of people or animals
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
flying squirrel/(dialect) bat
political climate
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to stop halfway/to give up halfway/interruption/suspension
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
